descript.abstract: All day and peak transit 20th, 50th, and 80th percentile speeds on segments estimated on a single day for all CA transit operators that provide GTFS real-time vehicle positions data. Segments are primarily stop to stop, but if stops are farther than 1km apart, additional segments between those stops will be added at 1km intervals.
descript.purpose: Average all-day, peak, and offpeak transit speeds by segments for all CA operators that provide GTFS real-time vehicle positions data.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Full name of the transit agency
A standardized route_name for the route_id (can be route_short_name, route_long_name, or route_desc)

Indicates the direction of travel for a trip. This field should not be used in routing; it provides a way to separate trips by direction when publishing time tables. Valid options are 0 - Travel in one direction (e.g. outbound travel). 1 - Travel in the opposite direction (e.g. inbound travel).

Identifies a segment, formatted as stop_id-stop_id-n. n is 1 for the first segment between those stops. If those stops are farther than 1km apart, additional segments between those stops will be added, incrementing n by 1 for each km.
A pair of stops. Identifies the current stop_name and the subsequent stop_name. The stop pair name value is created internally by concatenating two stop name with double underscores.
The 20th percentile speed (mph) for all trips associated with the route_id, direction_id, segment_id, and time_period.
The 50th percentile speed (mph) for all trips associated with the route_id, direction_id, segment_id, and time_period.
The 80th percentile speed (mph) for all trips associated with the route_id, direction_id, segment_id, and time_period.
The number of trips used to find the 20th, 50th, and 80th percentile speeds within the segment.
The number of trips scheduled to operate for this segment and time period.
The scheduled frequency for this segment and time period, in trips per hour

The time period over which the metric is calculated. Valid options are offpeak - offpeak hours are 12am-6:59am inclusive, 10am-2:59pm inclusive, and 8pm-11:59pm inclusive. peak - peak hours are 7am-9:59am inclusive and 3pm-7:59pm inclusive. all_day
The base64 encoded url for the feed associated with the agency

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
